item.title: Why Vim?
item.description:
Leaving VS Code was hard, but necessary.

The modal editing nature of Vim allows me to edit code at the “speed of thought”. Instead of reaching for the mouse to highlight a line, I simply press dd. And the speed of the homerow is a delight.

It’s not just about speed; it’s about reducing friction between my brain and the codebase. It is about keeping the environment simple to focus in solving the problem, writing the right lines.

The Problem

Standard terminal games lack visual engagement, while full GUI frameworks hide the low-level complexities. The goal was to build a “Hangman” style game that runs primarily in the Linux Console for input logic but renders progressive images in a separate X11 window, without relying on modern game engines.

The Solution

I engineered a native C application that bridges standard I/O with the X Window System.
